ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] A single seed crawling completed
ygData.msgSnippet: If you mean: knowing when all URIs discovered on specific hostname have been crawled, the hosts report , with one line per hostname, has as its 5th column

If you mean: knowing when all URIs discovered on specific hostname have 
been crawled, the 'hosts report', with one line per hostname, has as its 
5th column '[#remaining]', meaning the URI count still waiting to be 
crawled.

You can request the generation of this report during a crawl by visiting 
the URI 
<https://[your-crawler-host:port]/engine/job/[your-job]/report/HostsReport>. 


That report is not something you'd want to regenerate every few seconds, 
and its calculation can be costly in a large crawl, but it might do the 
trick.

If you want a more efficient/frequent check, you'd have to integrate 
your own code, either Java or one of the supported scripting languages. 
To get started investigating possibilities you could try short scripts 
in the web UI's 'Scripting Console'; for example the following line of 
Groovy will print back through the web UI the count of URIs remaining in 
the queue for "mysite.com" (assuming default queue-naming policies in 
effect):

rawOut.println(appCtx.getBean("frontier").getQueueFor("com,mysite,").getCount())

We've discussed adding an on-disk log of major events in frontier 
queues, like queue created, queue emptied, queue hitting certain 
thresholds of completion. See:

https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-935

If/when that feature arrives, monitoring that log might provide what you 
need, given that usually there is one queue per host.

- Gordon @ IA

On 12/13/10 6:16 AM, progre55 wrote:
> Hi people.
>
> Using H3.
> How is it possible to find out if a seed I've added has been completely crawled?
> I'm using a single domain crawl, and have seeds as surts. I add seeds, like mysite.com, mysite2.com and would like to somehow find out if all the links from mysite.com have been fetched, or that a given CrawlURI is the last one in the frontier queue for its "via"/"parent" URI.
> I dont mean to get it on the UI, but maybe on the CrawlURI or Frontier level?
>
> Thanks in advance.
>
> Regards,
> progre55
